name: three-gltf-viewer
description: Preview glTF models using three.js and a drag-and-drop interface.

scripts.build: browserify src/browser.js tools/Tool*.js --no-dedupe -p [ factor-bundle -o 'cat > bundle.`basename $FILE`' ] -o bundle.common.js
scripts.build:dev: browserify src/browser.js tools/Tool*.js --debug --no-dedupe -p [ factor-bundle -o 'cat > bundle.`basename $FILE`' ] -o bundle.common.js
scripts.build:uglify: browserify src/browser.js tools/Tool*.js --debug -g uglifyify --no-dedupe -p [ factor-bundle -o 'exorcist bundle.`basename $FILE`.map > bundle.`basename $FILE`' ] | exorcist bundle.common.js.map > bundle.common.js
scripts.build:production: browserify src/browser.js tools/Tool*.js -g uglifyify --no-dedupe -p [ factor-bundle -o 'cat > bundle.`basename $FILE`' ] | cat > bundle.common.js
scripts.package: npm run package:windows && npm run package:mac && npm run package:linux
scripts.watch: watchify src/browser.js tools/Tool*.js --debug --no-dedupe -p [ factor-bundle -o 'cat > bundle.`basename $FILE`' ] -v -o bundle.common.js
scripts.deploy: npm run build && now --static && npm run clean

author: Don McCurdy <dm@donmccurdy.com> (https://www.donmccurdy.com)
